column4: If my partitions are setup like [C:][D:][unalloted], can I move unalloted between C and D any way?
Anone know if I can move a non adjacent partition to next to it if there is another partiion in the way like | C: | D: | unalloted |?
How hard is it to "hop" paritions
and I can move the partition over with gparted ?
you can mirrior the partition you want moved out of sequence, then after you verify its ok, you can remove the original
i guess maybe we should ask why you think they need moved first?
tell us what your trying to accomplish, maybe we can give you better answers
unalloted space is just that unused, its not part of D:
unalloted space is not part of a partition, hence its unalotted. If you want to use it the easy way would be grow D: into it
are you running linux or windows or both?
in in simple, which partition did you want bigger?

ok then what you do is, you grow d into the unalocated space. when that is done, you drag the front edge of D and shrink it again, making a gap between C and D. When that finishes, you drag the back edge of C and give it the sapce you just made
partition tools are free, but the average MS user isnt capable of using them without destroying the whole works.
ive no idea what you just said
